page.title: 20CARE OF THE ELDERLY.
page.content: { {Batterflats}is a red brick building , with white window frames.Surrounded by it's own grounds full of trees and grass.There is a slope at the front of the house so wheelchairs can go up and down with ease.Batterflats is a sheltered home which means that the people inside are not able to take care of themselves.A matron looks after them in small groups.At the moment there are 31 beds and 1 vacancy. There is not lower age limit but they are hesitant to accept people under 60.The patients are mainly stroke victims or very old people. {Westerlands}is similar type of home where the elderly pay for their care. If they become bed_ridden they have to go to a{geriatric ward}in the hospital.Some old people stay on their own or with their children.(A.CURLEY.)
